name: Glencairn Trail, Divis and the Black Mountain

ai.summary: A 6.2 km moderate circuit along the Glencairn Trail around Divis and the Black Mountain in the UK, featuring rolling upland scenery, grassy slopes, and expansive views from exposed ridgelines.
ai.terrain_summary: Grassy upland paths with occasional rocky sections and short ascents. Expect exposed ridgelines and potential mud after rain; footing is generally good but boots with grip are advised.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in UK uplands can change rapidly; check a current forecast before you go. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress in layers. Stay on marked paths and be prepared for wind on the ridges. Bring a map and compass or GPS and know how to use them. Take sufficient water and high-energy snacks. Let someone know your route and expected return time. Carry a small first-aid kit and a whistle for emergencies. In winter or wet conditions the terrain can be more challenging and daylight is shorter; reconsider if conditions are poor.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March-October) for better visibility and drier conditions; winter hikes can be more challenging due to mud, ice and shorter daylight.
